name: Anaconda
description: distribution of scientific softwares

name: Application Programming Interface
description: specifications of communication protocols between software components

name: Binder
description: web-application for Jupyter notebook visualization from a GitHub repository

name: Conda
description: package management system used in Anaconda

name: Cygwin
description: collection of tools which provide Linux functionalities on Windows

name: Cython
description: optimising static compiler from Python to C

name: Docker
description: software container platform (alternative to VM)

name: findstat
description: collaborative database for combinatorial statistics

name: flint
description: C library for number theory

name: GAP
description: CAS for discrete computational algebra

name: git
description: a version control system

name: GitHub
description: git based hosting service for software development

name: GitLab
description: wiki and issue tracking system for software development projects (see also trac)

name: IPython
description: command shell for interactive computing

name: Jupyter
description: web-application for interactive computations

name: JupyterHub
description: configurable multi-user Jupyter server

name: LinBox
description: exact linear algebra \CC{} library

name: L-functions and Modular Forms Database
description: collaborative knowledge and data-base for number theory

name: MathHub
description: portal for active mathematical documents and formalizations

name: Meta-Meta-Tool
description: data/knowledge/software management framework based on OMDoc/MMT

name: MPIR
description: C library for multiprecision integer and rational arithmetic

name: notebook diffing and merging
description: Python library for version control for Jupyter notebooks

name: nbval
description: Python library to test Jupyter notebooks

name: numpy
description: Python library for N-dimensional arrays and linear algebra

name: The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences
Open Mathematical Documents / Meta Meta Theories
description: representation format

name: OpenMath
description: extensible standard for representing the semantics of mathematical objects

name: Open Multi-Processing
description: API for parallel programming

name: PARI/GP
description: C library for number theory and command line interface

name: Python
description: programming language and interpreter

name: Pythran
description: Python to \CC{} compiler for a subset of the Python language

name: SageMath/Sage
description: CAS which aggregates dozens of other softwares and libraries such as FLINT, GAP, LinBox, MPIR, PARI/GP, Singular

name: sphinx
description: software to create documentation

name: SageMathCloud
description: web-appliction and website for collaborative work around SageMath, Jupyter, LaTeX, \ldots

name: SciPy
description: Python libraries for mathematics, science, and engineering

name: SCSCP
description: Symbolic Computation Software Composability Protocol

name: SIMD
description: Single Instruction Multiple Data (in-core parallelism)

name: Singular
description: CAS for commutative algebra and algebraic geometry

name: Son of Grid Engine and derivatives
description: distributed resource manager and batch job scheduler for HPC clusters

name: trac
description: wiki and issue tracking system for software development projects (see also GitLab)

name: Virtual Machine
description: software that emulates a computer in an operating system
